message.content:
We must “build” the ending balance for the Interest Receivable account by summing up every “Interest Receivables” entry during the period. In our books no “Interest Receivable” appears on the opening (initial) trial balance – the only “Initial” entries are for cash, bank deposits, fixed assets, etc. (so the opening interest receivables balance is zero).

Then we simply “add” every interest‐related transaction (which in our trial balance all have “Unpaid” status) to see what balance has accumulated by period end.

Step‐by‐step, list the interest transactions (by the id in the “type” column – those with type “Interest Receivables”) and “amount” as given:

1. Interest20240101001: 1,335.0  
2. Interest20240102002: 1,335.0  
3. Interest20240103003: 1,246.0  
4. Interest20240104004: 1,246.0  
5. Interest20240105005: 1,246.0  
6. Interest20240106006: 1,068.0  
7. Interest20240107007: 1,068.0  
8. Interest20240108008: 801.0  
9. Interest20240109009: 729.8  
10. Interest20240110010: 729.8  
11. Interest20240111011: 729.8  
12. Interest20240112012: 729.8  
13. Interest20240113013: 729.8  
14. Interest20240114014: 729.8  
15. Interest20240115015: 685.3  
16. Interest20240116016: 418.3  
17. Interest20240117017: 418.3  
18. Interest20240118018: 418.3  
19. Interest20240119019: 418.3  
20. Interest20240120020: 418.3

23. Interest20240123023: 418.3  
24. Interest20240124024: 418.3  
25. Interest20240125025: 418.3  
26. Interest20240126026: 275.9  
27. Interest20240127027: 275.9  
28. Interest20240128028: 275.9  
29. Interest20240129029: 275.9  
30. Interest20240130030: 186.9  
31. Interest20240131031: 186.9  
32. Interest20240201032: 97.9  
33. Interest20240202033: 97.9  
34. Interest20240203034: 97.9  
35. Interest20240204035: 97.9  
36. Interest20240205036: 97.9  

Now we add them sequentially:

• 1,335.0 + 1,335.0 = 2,670.0  
• + 1,246.0 = 3,916.0  
• + 1,246.0 = 5,162.0  
• + 1,246.0 = 6,408.0  
• + 1,068.0 = 7,476.0  
• + 1,068.0 = 8,544.0  
• + 801.0 = 9,345.0  
• + 729.8 = 10,074.8  
• + 729.8 = 10,804.6  
• + 729.8 = 11,534.4  
• + 729.8 = 12,264.2  
• + 729.8 = 12,994.0  
• + 729.8 = 13,723.8  
• + 685.3 = 14,409.1  
• + 418.3 = 14,827.4  
• + 418.3 = 15,245.7  
• + 418.3 = 15,664.0  
• + 418.3 = 16,082.3  
• + 418.3 = 16,500.6  
• + 418.3 = 16,918.9  
• + 418.3 = 17,337.2  
• + 418.3 = 17,755.5  
• + 418.3 = 18,173.8  
• + 418.3 = 18,592.1  
• + 275.9 = 18,868.0  
• + 275.9 = 19,143.9  
• + 275.9 = 19,419.8  
• + 275.9 = 19,695.7  
• + 186.9 = 19,882.6  
• + 186.9 = 20,069.5  
• + 97.9 = 20,167.4  
• + 97.9 = 20,265.3  
• + 97.9 = 20,363.2  
• + 97.9 = 20,461.1  
• + 97.9 = 20,559.0  

Thus the ending balance in the Interest Receivables account (all “unpaid” amounts) is 20,559.00.

Also, since there was no beginning “Interest Receivable” balance (no “Initial” interest entry), the initial value is 0.00.

Therefore the solution is:

{
  "solution": {
    "Interest Receivable Initial Value": "0.00",
    "Interest Receivable End Value": "20559.00"
  }
}
